comment: Apply commuted form of ~ frege81 when the property ` R ` is hereditary in a disjunction of two properties, only one of which is known to be held by ` X ` . Proposition 83 of [Frege1879] p. 65. Here we introduce the union of classes where Frege has a disjunction of properties which are represented by membership in either of the classes. (Contributed by RP, 1-Jul-2020.) (Revised by RP, 5-Jul-2020.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
